title: Drawing, Design for Sideboard in Plan and Elevation, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Sideboard in Plan and Elevation
medium: Pen and black ink on thin cream paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, below elevation: SIDEBOARD OF MAHOGANY AND INLAY / INCH SCALE: at top right corner of elevation: BRASS RAIL; lower right corner of elevation: BRASS; across bottom of plan: PLAN; and upper right of plan: BRASS RAIL.  Inscribed in graphite across bottom of elevation, numerical notations indicating dimensions
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description:
Elevation view: oblong sideboard with 6 straight tapering legs [4 shown] with foot rings; tri-partite front has 4 drawers arranged in 3 rows, flanked by 2 doors with patera medallions at centers; molded top had brass rail at back.
Plan: shows molded oblong top with rounded corners and brass rail across back and wrapped slightly around sides.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Sideboard in Plan and Elevation, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-47.
